resources.string: This page provides information about the app\'s creation and licensing.
This app is designed to help students and teams prepare for Science Bowl competitions. This app is not sponsored by the National Science Bowl®, U.S. Department of Energy or the U.S. Government.
This app was created by Jake Polatty, co-captain of the Stanford University Online High School Science Bowl Team.

This app uses questions released by the National Science Bowl® that have been used at regional competitions in previous years. The questions taken from the National Science Bowl® website are the property of the Department of Energy and are available to the general public at no cost.
This page provides information about the app\'s different modes and settings.

Quiz Mode: Multiple-choice only quiz mode that tests your knowledge against a clock and tracks statistics of your performance. You can select any category or pull questions from all categories (random option), and can also choose the time limits for tossup and bonus questions.

Reader Mode: Designed for coaches and team leaders to use in meetings to run practice rounds. You can select any specific set from the online database by the set number and round, and can set custom time limits. Reader Mode also includes an 8-minute half timer so you can run full competition-style scrimmage rounds under time constraints.
Study Mode: Casual mode used for studying questions without a time limit. You can select any category (or all categories) and any round difficulty level (or allow questions from all rounds).
